alert.note: Alert for Gilchrist; Western Alachua (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Gilchrist, west central Alachua and southwestern Columbia Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 600 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near High Springs, or 10 miles east of Bell, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort White. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
